newsitem.title: INDIA: RBI chief to make "courtesy call" on India's PM.
newsitem.headline: RBI chief to make "courtesy call" on India's PM.

text.p: Indian Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda will meet Reserve Bank of India governor C. Rangarajan in Bombay this week, a Finance Ministry spokeswoman said on Wednesday.
However, the spokeswoman denied a newspaper report that Deve Gowda and the central bank chief would discuss the state of the nation's capital markets at the meeting.

The Economic Times reported on Wednesday that Deve Gowda had convened a series of high-level meetings in Bombay for Friday "to discuss the liquidity crunch in the industry and capital markets reforms".
"There is no meeting to prop up the markets as such," the spokeswoman said, noting that Deve Gowda planned to be in Bombay for several separate engagements.
"The prime minister will happen to be in Bombay," she said. "The RBI governor is going to call on him. It will be a courtesy call."
The spokeswoman said the meeting between Deve Gowda and the central bank governor "has been blown out of proportion".
A government spokesman said Deve Gowda's programme in Bombay had not yet been finalised and he could go there on Thursday or Friday.
